items.title: Interactive Designer / UI Designer at Alliance Reservations Network (Phoenix, AZ) (allows remote)
items.content:
Do not apply if you do not live in the United States. Direct hires only, no
agencies. Do not apply if you are a programmer who can do some design, we want
someone who specializes in interaction design.

Our internet-based technology company based in Phoenix and Orlando is looking
for a full time U/I and U/X designer with strong CSS/JavaScript skills and an
very strong eye towards modern interactive design to help us create a better
user experience for our existing application.

Qualified candidates must understand and care deeply about the purpose of our
proprietary application and various types of users that utilize this valuable
tool. Each screen must be designed with the specific user and their needs and
capabilities in mind, not in the candidate's own personal design aptitude.
Candidates must be able to express a Zen sense of minimalism that considers the
necessity of every element on a page to determine whether each element directly
contributes to achieving the goal of the page.

Candidates must push management to simplify the application versus management
pushing them.

Candidates must be able to create usable interfaces for both experienced and
one-time users and understand their needs are vastly different. Also,
candidates must be able to build a U/I a user can use without little of no
instruction and without confusion. Candidates must want to step-up and take
ownership of the user interface and take pride in its successes and be willing
to take responsibility for its weaknesses understanding the design will
constantly evolve and must always improve.

Our company is looking to take our application to the "next level" and we want
a candidate who is self-managed and always pushing for progress without the
need for constant supervision. As a leader of the design of this application,
the candidate we select will be joining a team with two backend developers and
a small sales staff. This candidate must be able to balance the requests from
sales with the programmers ability to deliver features and functions that do
not negatively impact the user experience.

Lastly, the ideal candidate should be the kind of person who could name famous
designers in your field that you follow or want to emulate rather than the type
who lives in a bubble of his own personal design ego. During the interview
process, the candidates should be able to discuss their inspirational leaders
and discuss what I is about them that impresses you most.

If you feel you have the requisite skills and experience for the position, and
have a portfolio of work you would like to share, please email us
jobs@allresnet.com . We will contact you only if
we're interested, make sure your work is easily visible.

Skills & Requirements

* HTML
* Javascript
* Zen like taste for simplicity

Alliance Reservations Network has been building hotel booking engine

consolidate inventory from around the world, ensuring our partners always have
access to the most comprehensive and competitive rates in the industry.

items.content:
Booking.com BV (the company behind Booking.com™, the market leading online
accommodation reservation service in the world) is looking for the world’s
smartest designers. As a member of our Front End team you’ll be given the
freedom to make meaningful and measurable improvements impacting millions of
people. You’ll join us at our beautiful Amsterdam HQ and work with some of our
industry’s smartest people.

B.responsible

Our guiding principle is that by helping our users we help our business. As a
designer in our Front End team you’ll be a key part of the idea generation
process, working in a small startup-like group which takes full ownership of
their part of our platform. You’ll work with developers, product owners,
copywriters and user researchers to conceive, analyse, hand code & test your
ideas.

B.creative

‘Designer’ is just what it says on your CV – you’d be just as happy to be
labeled an Engineer, or Analyst; a Builder, Hacker or Maker. Because what you
really do, what you live for, is solving problems. Your portfolio isn’t a
series of beautiful but generic templates – it’s a collection of stories that
you can discuss with enthusiasm, and regret … because you’re always getting
better at what you do and you’re never satisfied with ‘good enough.’. You’re
equally comfortable discussing colour theory, user psychology, or the semantic
implications of the DIV tag, you’re a writer of excellent HTML & CSS. You’re
excited about the endless potential of the web, and being able to build things
that millions of people can use every day.

Skills & Requirements

B.skilled

Your core responsibility will be in combining your knowledge and expertise
with the goals of our business to deliver a world-class user experience to our
diverse, loyal user-base. You’ll be comfortable taking a data-led approach to
design. You will be a passionate advocate for the user, dedicated to the craft
of design and excited about working in an agile, collaborative environment.

* Experience: You have at least two years of relevant experience
* Simplicity: Good design is invisible.
* Collaboration: You’ll be working alongside developers and copywriters to
create elegant user experiences; you should thrive on feedback, critique and
iteration.
* Visual Design: Photoshop, Fireworks, Keynote, MS Paint – whatever works for
you. Your process is your own; you get to decide which tools you use.
* HTML/CSS: You’ll be given full ownership of your ideas, and so you’ll be
required to both create beautiful mockups/wireframes/prototypes – and implement
them.
* Data: You are a successful Designer, but you like to measure your success
with data and learn from it every day
* E-Commerce: You understand the challenges and the opportunities that a
large e-commerce website has to offer
* You’re excited to learn how to work with our templating and version control
systems.

items.title: Chromatic: Front-end Designer / Developer
items.content:
Full-time

(Anywhere)

Chromatic in a Nutshell


Chromatic is a world-class digital agency focused on web design, development,
process, and training. We have over 10 years experience helping some of the
web's biggest brands solve their content problems using Drupal and other open
source technologies. Our team is completely distributed, and while we may be
spread across the globe, our culture keeps us close together.

Role Summary

Chromatic is looking for an outgoing and motivated front-end
designer/developer with strong communication skills who would be energized to
work with a talented and strongly bound team.

Responsibilities

* Work closely with clients to deliver exceptional designs, code, consulting,
and advice.
* Participate in and contribute to peer design/code reviews and project
stand-ups.
* Evangelize design/development best practices to Chromatic’s clients and the
community.
* Engage with the open-source community via code contributions, projects,
presentations, blog posts, etc.
What We Are Looking For

Experience with the following is required:

* Proficient in designing and delivering assets via HTML/CSS.
* Strong proficiency in core front-end development technologies (HTML5, CSS3,
JavaScript/jQuery).
* CSS preprocessors.
* Task runners.
* Web content management systems.
* Developing responsive web and/or mobile applications.
* Creation of and adherence to best practices.
Experience with the following is a plus:

* ES6.
* HTML5 APIs.
* Object-oriented patterns.
* Drupal theming.
* Agile project management methodologies.
* Git and GitHub pull request/code review workflows.
* Designing, developing and maintaining front-end component libraries or
style guides.
Some Other Important Traits

* Chromatic is a distributed team, so strong communication skills, both
verbal and written, are of the utmost importance.
* The ability to brainstorm ideas, do research, remain current with industry
trends and best practices.
* Enthusiasm, personality, teamwork and a positive attitude count
tremendously.
What sets Chromatic apart from a typical job?

* Work from wherever you want, whenever you want - Our office is completely
distributed, you may work from wherever is most effective for you. We encourage
our team members to work when it is convenient for them, when they’ll do their
best work.
* Reasonable Bookings - We book our team members with a max of 30-35 hours
per week for project work. We believe more than that is asking too much. The
other 5-10 hours is reserved for team meetings, community contribution, and
professional/skill development.
* Vacation - Chromatic does not set rigid vacation limits. We encourage our
people to take vacation when they want/need it. So long as it doesn’t interfere
with existing contracts or compromise project deadlines, we’re all for it.
* Health Insurance - Chromatic provides competitive medical/dental/vision
insurance.
* 401(k) - Chromatic provides employees a 401k plan along with a 3% employer
contribution.
* Disability Insurance - Chromatic provides both short and long term
disability insurance.
* Life Insurance - All employees are provided with a term life insurance
policy.
* Hardware - Chromatic is primarily an Apple-based company, but we allow our
team members to choose their own hardware and we ensure everyone has up-to-date
equipment and software.
* Exciting Projects - Chromatic consistently participates in projects with
exciting, high-profile brands and some of the most highly trafficked sites on
the web; some of which include Martha Stewart, NBC / MSNBC, Shape, Parents,
Casper, State Farm, Emeril Brands, Adobe.
* Conferences - Chromatic frequently sends team members to attend and speak
at industry conferences, including Drupalcon.
* Company Retreat - Once a year, we gather the entire company to spend
quality time together away from our desks.
* Spotify Subscription - Music is important to us; we provide for a Spotify
subscription (or equivalent) for all of our employees.
* Drupalize.me Membership - Want to spend your extra hours improving your
Drupal skills? We have a Drupalize.me membership at the ready.
* UrbanSitter Membership - For our team members with child care needs.
* Workflow - We firmly believe in a strong, consistent deployment workflow.
We insist on proper code reviews on all of our projects. This not only ensures
our code quality but more so, makes us better developers.
* Team & Culture - We work and support each other as a team. We make an
effort to get together numerous times per year and support each other
personally and professionally at every opportunity.

items.title: Help Scout: Designer
items.content:
Full-time

(anywhere)

Designers at Help Scout are responsible for the brand, and for creating an
exceptional product experience. Everything customer-facing passes through the
design team in some way. You’ll be making things that are seen and/or used by
several hundred thousand people every month.

About the role

* You'll be part of our 5-person design team, and you’ll report to Jared, one
of Help Scout’s co-founders. Each designer brings a unique set of skills to the
group and makes their colleagues better.
* You’ll be working on our website, which sees just under half a million
unique visitors every month. In addition to designing, coding and deploying new
work for the site, you’ll help us push into new formats: video, podcast, new
media and other experiments. We’ll look to you to raise the creative bar on
these efforts.
* You'll be working in a design-led company, with people that give you the
time to do excellent work. But we also hold you to high standards, which means
you must be incredibly persistent, open to feedback/debate and always willing
to experiment with new ideas.
Who you'll work with

* Jared McDaniel, Co-founder & Designer - Jared brings a great deal of
knowledge and experience to our brand, our products, and our marketing site.
* Stephen Murrill, Illustrator & Visual Designer - Stephen’s expertise and
vision helps guide our brand, ensuring that Help Scout is presented
consistently and beautifully across-the-board.
* Eli Overbey, Growth Engineer - Eli manages our paid channels, SEO, and data
analytics. In addition, you’ll work with him to continually improve our
pre-signup user experience.
* Nadia Basil, Head of Product Marketing - Nadia is a master of words. You’ll
work with her to craft every last word on our marketing pages, and within the
product.
REQUIREMENTS

About you

* You love shipping new things. Working alongside our Growth team means
you’ll be moving quickly on a number of projects and experiments. Once we know
how an experiment plays out, there’s time to polish and improve your work.
* You can write beautiful html and css, and have a good sense for interaction
design principles. Javascript skills are a bonus, but not required to be
successful in this position.
* Most of your creative work starts in Sketch or Photoshop. Visual design is
a skill that you’re passionate about.
* You never stop working on your craft. When looking at your work over the
years, it's clear you've never stopped improving.
* You are a great communicator. You have no trouble keeping your teammates in
the loop and getting work done in the time allotted for it.
About us

* Help Scout is a remote team with employees in eleven countries (eight
people in the Boston office). We optimize for excellence over geography and
overcome remote challenges through transparency, trust, chat and video
conferencing.
* We’re a customer-driven company and always will be. Everything follows the
customer experience, no exceptions.
* Our company is growing and has aspirations of helping millions of people
around the world. Accomplishing our goals will present countless challenges and
require you to excel in every aspect of the position. It’s hard work, but the
people we’re looking for love exploring and solving hard problems.
* This is not the typical startup “rocket ship.” We’ll never compromise
customers or the experience in favor of growth. Our purpose is to build a
profitable company that small businesses love and sustain it. We optimize your
career at Help Scout for the long term as well, so keeping a healthy work/life
balance is an important priority.
* We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We
do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin,
gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status,
veteran status, or disability status.
BENEFITS

* Competitive Salary - We pay at or above market salary in most cases and
evaluate a lot of research to make sure everyone is paid well. The formula we
use to calculate all salaries is public to employees and is improved upon
regularly.
* Work anywhere - Work from our office in Boston or anywhere else, provided
you have 4 hours of overlap with the team. We’ll even buy your home office
furniture or help you pay for a co-working space.
* Health and dental insurance - We cover you and your family's health/dental
insurance 100%. If you are based in the US, we'll cover you on our Harvard
Pilgrim HMO or PPO policies.
* Long-term/Short-term Disability Insurance & Life Insurance - we cover 100%
of the premiums for LT/ST Disability insurance and base Life Insurance. You
also have the option to purchase supplementary life insurance through our
provider.
* International Benefit Stipend - If you’re based outside the US, you’ll
receive a monthly stipend that goes towards covering medical insurance, long
and short-term disability, and accountant costs.
* Flexible vacation - Take time off when you need it, we trust you.
* Paid parental leave, including adoption - 12 weeks if you have or adopt a
baby, 4 weeks if your partner has a baby.
* 401k with 1% match- 1% Retirement Plan matching for both US and
International Employees
* Personal development stipend - Up to $1,800 per year to improve your craft
* Great tools - Each employee receives a Mac laptop and 27'' display (or
equivalent). We’ll also purchase any of the software or hardware you need as
well as high-end furniture to get your home office started
* Complete transparency - Everyone has full access to business metrics and
financial information about the company.

* 5+ years of design experience with both UI & UX
* Excited about getting your hands dirty with the entire scope of creating, implementing and overseeing our design
* Resourceful, dependable, proactive and an excellent communicator
* Very advanced in your understanding of typography, leading, grids and visual layout and design systems
* A problem solver who can interpret the complicated and manual tasks that exist around insurance today, making it easy for people to understand the risks they face, organise their policies, and automate how they insure themselves
* Able to show off a comprehensive online portfolio of your design work
* Well versed with HTML/CSS and have an good understanding of technology


*It excites us if you*

* Have lead the design at a startup previously
* Have your own side projects
* Believe that insurtech startups should be winning design awards!


We love engineering. We love design. And we love insurance - or what we know it should be.

At Brolly we're obsessed with creating an entirely new concept of personal insurance, and a product that customers love.

We're a small team that's growing fast. Our team is enthusiastic, friendly, and respectful. We love the things that make you different, and we love solving hard problems.

We're looking for determined, passionate big thinkers to join us on our ambitious undertaking to build the future of the insurance industry.

items.title: Senior Product Designer
items.content:
If you’re a passionate innovator, a creative person with deep obsession with designing customer experiences end-to-end, across different media and platforms, this is your dream job.

We are looking for a Senior Product Designer with a strong background in UX/UI but who’s also been involved in designing customer experiences in a more extended sense. You don’t just stop at making things look pretty, you obsess about how you trigger the right emotions in the customer throughout their experience, how you make a product more functional but also more engaging.

You will be working closely with the CEO and CTO to conceive, prototype and design new products at a high level pre-production, as part of a core rapid innovation team.


Will must have

Strong UX/UI background (5+ years)
Mastery of Adobe Illustrator, Photoshop and other tools such as Sketch and Keynote
Proficiency in prototyping tools such as Flinto, Principal and InVision
Experience with motion and interactive design
Track record of designing features/products that WOW customers
Strong obsession with customer flow & experience
Experience in user testing and optimisation
Worked with C-level execs in designing new products
Worked with or understand analytics to optimise the design process
Creative thinking
Strong design sense and taste
Passion and drive for innovation
Excellent communication and team-work skills


Location: Based in Soho, London.

Remuneration:Competitive base + Stock options

About Us
Founded in 2008, PeoplePerHour.com is a mature startup serving the burgeoning on-demand/ freelance economy globally. With offices in Athens and London, we are a savvy team of ca. 50 and growing, serving a community of over 1.5million users around the world.
We’ve raised over $10m in our lifetime but that’s the part we care the least about. What gets us out of bed is the mission and purpose we serve, which is to empower people the world over to seek their dreams of being financially independent.
We love building products, we hate fundraising, we remain independent, profitable, growing and proud to be part of a movement that is undoubtedly the future.
We are now building a core Innovation team, headed by our CEO and CTO for new products, whose goal is to utilise the assets we’ve built over the past 10 years to develop new products in the burgeoning on-demand economy. You will be an integral part of this.

items.title: UX Designer (Bristol)
items.content:
Designed and co-developed with educators, Spiral is a suite of apps that can be used on any internet-connected device in a classroom. Each app is designed to mirror a specific classroom practice and can be used across all subjects and age ranges.

We're looking for a UX designer to work with us either part time or full time at our Bristol office, because we want to do this well.

The role of UX designer will give you full ownership of your work. You will be responsible for solving challenges of user interaction between students and teachers in a classroom setting via apps that replicate known teaching practices. This will require a high level of creativity and original thinking because you will be solving problems that haven't been solved before.

We're looking for someone who:

• Works well in small, agile teams.
• Can handle a high level of ambiguity and deliver well thought out solutions that are the best fit.
• Can communicate well with stakeholders such as teachers, headmasters, investors, and the product team.
• Ability to work directly with a lead developer and a graphic designer.
• Exceptional written and oral communication skills. Can work with different nationalities in different locations.
• Passionate about technology, willingness to learn and try new things.
• Coding skills not necessary but an understanding of how coders work is highly desired.

Perks:
• Flexible office hours with an option to work from home if required.
• Competitive Salary.

items.title: Senior Designer
items.content:
StreetTeam is looking for an experienced digital product designer; someone who can design beautiful visuals whilst ensuring a delightful experience for our users. We’re designing across a portfolio of products, for a broad range of users and across multiple platforms as well as defining and refining our own brand.
This is a hands-on design position. If you share our real passion for crafting elegant designs that solve real problems for users then you could be just what we need!

What you will do in the next 12 months:
-Work with the Head of Design to define the design language of multiple digital products
-Work in a cross-functional team of developers, product owners and other designers, contributing both to the overall strategy as well as the small details
-Design experiences and flows that offer real value and solve problems for our users
-Respond to our research and user testing learnings and make improvements based on what we find out
-Suggest and action improvements to the design creation process
-Help reimagine and build the StreetTeam brand

Who you are:
-You love design; from the big picture flows through to the pixel details.
-You care deeply about what you create and seeing people use it gets you excited
-You integrate your own best practice design knowledge with findings from data and user testing to design the -best possible solution to a problem
-You have excellent typography, colour and layout skills
-You’re comfortable working on projects from brainstorming and concepts through to polished designs, and then working with our developers to make them real
-You’re experienced and comfortable designing for native mobile apps and responsive web
StreetTeam is building a global network of advocates that brands can work with to sell their products and services.

We have established a beachhead in live entertainment working with some of the biggest music events in the world. You’ll be joining the company at an exciting time. Having just closed a major round of funding, we're building our London based product, design and engineering team from the ground up.

StreetTeam believes in freedom and ownership with the focus entirely on the value you create – there are no set hours, meetings are optional and you can take as much holiday as you need. We only care about the results you deliver. We are free-thinking, fast learners who want to inspire change. Are you?

items.title: Midweight Graphic Designer
items.content:
We’re looking for a seriously talented Designer to join Yellowball, our fast-growing marketing agency to get stuck into a variety of exciting live projects. As an Integrated Designer you will be undertaking the design and artwork of digital and print based collateral as well as website design. As a Yellowball designer you will be working on a variety of projects so adaptability is key!


*WHO ARE WE?*

Yellowball is an award-winning creative agency working with clients ranging from start ups through to larger blue chips across London, the UK and internationally. As a full service agency we operate across the marketing mix with our core services including:

* Web Design and development
* On and offline creative design across all platforms and mediums
* Branding
* Search Engine Optimisation
* Social Media


*SO, WHAT DOES YOUR DAY LOOK LIKE AT YELLOWBALL?*

Start your day in our new office near London Bridge. Get stuck in to whatever’s on your plate. The role will be challenging, require creativity and attention to detail as well as a strong cup coffee and a chat with one of the team. The good news is that you’ll be surrounded by a creative and talented group of people who are all in the same boat as you and willing to help.

It might be a new brand concept or website design, creating an editorial page for one of our client’s publications or helping someone tweak a design and get a presentation out. We’re a small team and everyone just mucks in and gets on with it whatever the challenge.


*WHAT WOULD YOU BE DOING?*

* Developing innovative concepts and bringing fresh design perspectives
* Managing multiple deadlines and ensuring all stages of design work are completed in sufficient time for production processes.
* Managing multiple briefs and communicate progress accurately to your team and clients
* Keeping abreast of the latest design trends
* Liaising directly with the clients on a daily basis
* You will be working on both digital and print based projects including website design, social imagery, branding, digital banners, leaflets, flyers, brochures and more
* You will produce final files for print, press and digital to required standards
* Delivering powerful but elegant creative solutions that help create delightful product experiences


*WE WOULD LOVE YOU TO:*

* Be experienced in working in an in-house design or agency environment preferably 2+ years
* Have strong typographic and layout skills
* Have the ability to work well under pressure and in a fast paced environment
* Have expert knowledge in Adobe Creative Suite – particularly InDesign, Illustrator and Photoshop
* Be able to communicate ideas quickly and efficiently to colleagues and clients
* Have a portfolio demonstrating strong conceptual thinking across a range of work
* Be enthusiastic and use initiative
* Have Coding and development experience too (but don’t worry – this isn’t vital)
* Work on own initiative whilst being a team player
* Have a meticulous eye for detail to ensure consistencies
* Oh, and we have an office dog.


*GREAT, HOW DO I APPLY?*

We’d love to hear from you. And we’d love to see your work too. So initially, please drop a brief (but engaging) message, together with a link or PDF attached of your best and most recent work, your CV, plus anything else you think will impress us like links to your blogs or other sites. If we think there’s a match, we’ll invite you in for an interview, followed by a live 90 minute project in the studio.

items.title: Product Designer
items.content:
As a Product Designer, your objective will be to craft great mobile products and services with users at the heart. You’ll be able to confidently contribute to a project’s design activities from kickoff through to delivery. This role will give you the opportunity to conduct crucial research data analysis; producing deliverables to highlight exciting insights for the team and stakeholders. You’ll be ambitious and passionate about design’s role in product development and its potential to solve real-world problems!

As part of the wider Design team, you’ll be working on products and services for some of the world’s biggest brands including the likes of TFL, Unilever, Ford. You’ll be involved in the entire cycle; from planning through to execution becoming an ever-present advocate for the user. Your interest and focus will be in human-centred visual design, supported by a broad knowledge of common user interface design patterns, iconography, typography and colour theory.

You will be:

- Contributing to a project’s design workstream end-to-end, such as planning and participating in research activities with help from the wider team.
- Speaking to the product’s end users (through interviews or contextual research) to understand their needs and goals.
- Attending end-of-sprint reviews with the team and presenting your work to clients.
- Working collaboratively with brilliant Designers, Engineers, Strategists and other specialists to iterate and improve your designs.
- Delivering high quality work on time, setting your own work agenda and helping others on your team to do the same.
- Contributing to the Design team by helping identify and interview great new team mates
- Actively involved within the Design community; interest in reading books, articles and attending meetups.

You must have:

- Product Design and client-facing industry experience, ideally within an agency setting.
- An inquisitive mind and a keen problem solver who likes taking on challenging problems and conflicting objectives, and working collaboratively to find a solution.
- A strong portfolio of work demonstrating a variety of tools and the problem & approach taken, not just visuals.
- Knowledge or ideally experience of working within an agile, software development environment.
- Experience using Adobe CC Suite, Sketch, Keynote and prototyping tools of your choice.
- An eagerness to continuously improve and learn; either through books, articles, meetups etc.

items.title: Lead Experience Designer
items.content:
As a Lead Experience Designer at TAB, your objective will be to define the products of tomorrow and shape and drive our Design team’s capabilities, as we continue to scale at pace. You’ll be developing products for some of the world’s biggest brands, including TFL, Ford, Met Office and Unilever; providing guidance to the teams and pushing all our Designers to produce work of exceptional quality. You’ll be ambitious and passionate about Design’s role in product development; shaping our approach and becoming instrumental in scaling the team to enable great work!

Reporting into the Head of Design, you’ll be working on products and services across a wide variety of industries, helping our ambitious organisations to become more mobile and agile. You’ll be involved in the entire cycle; from planning through to execution, becoming an ever-present advocate for the user. You’ll help your team to make informed design decisions, placing the needs of the user and the business at the very heart of your work.

You will be:

- Working with the Head of Design to shape the strategic direction of the Design team.
- Setting the agenda and driving the weekly and monthly cadence for the whole Design team.
- Coaching Design team members to rapidly progress their careers and contribution to TAB.
- Establishing innovative ways of creating exciting ideas, bringing them to life and presenting them.
- Having full visibility and responsibility over client and customer context for design decisions.
- Actively involved in growing the Design team by finding and attracting the best Design talent.
- Understanding the needs of the live products and how they work, and matching them with the right Design team skills.

You must have:

- Significant experience at a Lead level, ideally within an agency setting.
- Strong experience shaping design approaches for multi-£million, client-facing projects.
- Worked within multidisciplinary teams and feel comfortable in a fast-paced agile environment.
- Extensive involvement in planning and conducting design research, and identifying patterns and insights from the research to inform and shape your product’s strategy.
- Adept at knowing when and how to use a range of deliverables (eg. user journeys, task models) to convey your arguments and support design decisions
- Extensive experience using Adobe CC Suite, Sketch, Keynote and prototyping tools of your choice.
- Ideally a keen interest and active involvement within the Design community (through meetups, talks articles etc).

About The App Business

Founded in 2009, The App Business runs fast and lean, creating awesome products and services for ambitious clients ready to rethink their business around mobile-enabled users. Based in the heart of London’s thriving King’s Cross, we work in an environment built to help us - and our clients - excel. We invest heavily in this vision, placing the support and development of our teams, as well as our culture, at the heart of everything we do.
As a company, we know it is important to acknowledge the effort our people put in - which is why we have a great range of benefits in place, which increase as people grow and develop within TAB. It is one of the many ways we ensure we say thank you, and has lead to us ranking as 'Outstanding' in the independent Best Companies Index.
If this sounds like the kind of place you want to work, apply now!

items.title: Web Designer & Developer at Edgar, Anywhere - USA, engineering
items.content:
Web Designer & Developer
Web Designer & Developer

ABOUT THE ROLE
We're Edgar (http://MeetEdgar.com

), a new social media SaaS tool for small businesses.

You’ll be our dedicated web designer, with some branding and interface design
work as well. You'll also be our primary web developer. Your focus will be on
designing marketing sites, assets, and landing pages for both sides of our
business, with an emphasis on making sure your creations fit in well with our
existing designs. While we have already established our brand identity for
Edgar, you will have room to grow, reinvent, and evolve our brand.

That means:

- creating websites and landing pages- making all of our sites functional and
beautiful on mobile/tablet
- designing worksheets, keynotes, and other content marketing materials
- ensuring all materials and web properties are consistent with our existing
visual identity and on-brand
- turning your designs into well-coded HTML/CSS/PHP and pushing them live
- testing the website and identifying technical problems (and fixing them!)
- split testing different design options to find the highest conversion
- creating shareable images to complement our blog posts
- creating ad images and other marketing assets
- performing routine site maintenance, updates, and site backups

This is the right fit for someone who loves creating their own projects top to
bottom. You’ll be proactively overseeing the look of everything that our
company produces - everything from fixing up poorly aligned text to creating
innovative, high-converting landing pages. You'll work alongside a
super-talented marketing and content team, but when it comes to design and
development, you'll own your own projects from start to finish.

You’ll spot opportunities for large and small-scale improvements and will push
us to make them. This is not a boring role and you’ll work at the micro and
macro levels - being both our creative director and button-maker!

ABOUT YOU

You are fast on your feet, dedicated to your craft, fun to be around and of
course . . . an incredibly talented web designer AND developer. You dream of
helping to define the design of an entire company, from home or anywhere else
you want. That’s why you’re perfect for this gig!

Beyond being a j’mazing designer/developer, you can identify with our users
and create the best possible experience for them as they interact with our
company. This means that you’ll follow every step a visitor will take as they
check out our blogs and resources, learn about our products (ranging from our
social media training courses to our software product, Edgar), make purchases,
and in and begin interacting with our products. Everything from opting in to
asking us questions will be enjoyable and simple because you’ve designed it
that way.

Our sites are in WordPress. You must be experienced with Twitter Bootstrap.
You will be expected to make your own designs live on our sites! If you have
experience with version control systems like Git or Mercurial, that's a HUGE
plus. Here are some designs we love - if your style isn’t similar, we aren’t a
good fit:http://pinterest.com/lkrsocialmedia/design-we-love/



ABOUT US

We are a small but mighty 10-person team, and we all work from our own homes
all over the country. You’ll do the same. That means you need to be super-human
at time management - organizing your own projects and completing them on time.

We’re NOT your typical startup. We don’t work weekends or nights (for real)
and we don’t expect you to, either. That being said, we love our work and take
huge pride in creating experiences for our customers that are fun, useful, and
rewarding. The work environment you’ll be a part of is casual, open, and
relaxed. Two of our core values are “dorkiness” and “whimsility”. (Yes, we made
that second one up.) You can read more about us and how we work at
http://meetedgar.com/careers

.

You'll be working during normal US business hours, Monday through Friday. This
is a stable job and we're looking for someone to grow with us long term. Please
do not apply unless this sounds like your DREAM JOB. We’ll get back to you if
we think you might be our DREAM designer-developer-wizard combo!

items.title: Lead Designer
items.content:
Carcela is a peer-to-peer serviced marketplace for used vehicles. An evolution of the car buying and selling experience.

Carcela will disrupt the £50 billion UK used car market, currently dominated by dealers making massive margins at the expense of the consumer.
Buying and selling privately is an alternative but few people have the time, and the hassle is unequivocal.
Carcela is to rejuvenate the industry, changing the way individuals buy and sell cars.
Out with the old, and in with the new as the removal of the car salesmen is replaced with a simple, transparent and trustworthy process that offers a better price and a better service to buyers and sellers by cutting out the middleman.
This is a unique opportunity to be involved, from inception, in one of the most exciting and ambitious peer-to-peer marketplaces to date.

We’re seeking a Lead Designer to create and deliver this vision for disrupting the used car market. You’ll be great at making, experimenting and testing, and you’ll get a kick when you see things go live and people using your product. Most importantly, you’re someone who enjoys working in small, energetic teams to create products and services that people love to use.

REQUIREMENTS

Who you are:

An audacious avid designer with a background in research and interaction design, but competent helping out across other disciplines. Mastery is not expected, but strategic initiative and competence are an obligation of a lead designer.
We expect you to bring a breadth of skills.
As we build out the team over the next year, you will help cultivate the type of individuals we bring in to build an awesome product team.

You might have worked at agencies, start-ups or even big, scaled products, and you're great at taking an idea or insight and capitalising and converting it into a new product, service or feature. You’re comfortable working closely with developers, and you love seeing the output of your work in the hands of users, even better when it’s on a big scale.

You’re experienced enough to work across a broad set of design disciplines and help shape and define our processes, but enthusiastic enough to roll your sleeves up and spend your time in the trenches of your time designing.

What you’ll do

You’ll be responsible (initially at least) for all areas of the Carcela's experience. This is an interesting design challenge that spans multiple touch-points including web, mobile, customer service and physical car delivery/collection. We’re a small team and we’ll be applying a very lean, ‘just enough’ mentality; just enough research to inform the design, just enough design to make something, just enough of a product to test…

We’ll be running a pilot in Q2 this year which you’ll be actively involved in. You’ll develop a deep understanding of who our customers are and what they need through customer interviews and usability testing. You’ll be responsible for conceptualising, testing and implementing new features. One week you might be looking at what mental models people have when they search for cars, and how this translates to product navigation. Another week you might be looking at how we integrate an insurance offering into the service or seeing how we can remove pain points associated with car delivery to maintain our streamlined, semi-automated systems.

Tl;dr

-An opportunity to join a well-backed start-up, lead by renowned, and accomplished personnel.
-It’s a brilliant customer proposition that offers better value and service to the consumer
-We’re looking for an all-round designer that is looking to create and simultaneously shape our team and processes.
-You will be making key decisions related to the product - there is no client or Creative Director to answer to. You are the head-honcho!
-This is a mass-market service that your friends and family will use


BENEFITS
-Fast paced start-up experience at a company looking to disrupt a massive market
-Work with a small high-performance team who will fight beside you to accomplish the amazing
-Opportunity to have a say in the business direction from the very start
-Competitive salary with equity in the business on offer

Product Designer
at Khan Academy Mountain View, CA
Khan Academy is looking for product designers who are passionate about great
design and have an ability to achieve it. Join us on our mission to provide a
free, world-class education for anyone, anywhere!

We’re fun, quirky people at heart that come from a wide variety of
backgrounds. Our team includes industry leaders from companies such as Apple,
Google, Facebook, tiny startups, games, and education, including people with
non-traditional backgrounds who didn’t graduate from college. Together, we’re a
small but elite group. We’re deeply invested in your future: we have high
expectations of you, and consider deeply how to support you to achieve them.

The design team is a small, super diverse group of people; each member has a
lot of impact and makes huge contributions across the board. As a good
candidate, you will have a great portfolio with a string of successful projects
in your wake. Your friends and coworkers think of you as the go-to person for
at least two of these:

* Interaction design
* Visual design
* Prototyping skills
* Information architecture
* User research and testing
We expect our designers to have solid technical skills. You should have a set
of tools that you love to use when designing. You’re able to show us how you've
used them in the past to make great products, and you can walk us through your
design reasoning. You can demonstrate that you’re invested in working well with
your peers and other disciplines, such as engineering and PM, throughout your
career – because we’re dedicated toboth great quality design and great quality
collaboration.

strong systematic problem solving ability

the future of learning

meaningful mission
